did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: A Guide to the Fleming and Webster Ledger, 1818-1827

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Fleming and Webster Ledger, 1818-1827. Local Government Records Collection, Goochland County Court Records, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court records from Goochland County Circuit Court.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Fleming and Webster was a law partnership in Goochland County, Virginia, that consisted of John S. Fleming and Samuel P. Webster.
The ledger was used as an exhibit in the chancery suit Executrix of John S. Fleming versus Creditors of John S. Fleming, heard in the Goochland County Circuit Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Fleming and Webster Ledger, 1818-1827, records charges for services rendered to clients. Information found includes name of client, date of transaction, service rendered, and amount owed.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: For additional information see the Goochland County Chancery Cause, Executrix of John S. Fleming versus Creditors of John S. Fleming. It can be found in the Local Records Collection at the Library of Virginia. The index number is 1878-007.
